intro: Corydalis aconitiflora, commonly known as the aconite corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant produces a cluster of small, heart-shaped leaves and has a compact growth habit. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral structure, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
